content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans! 

Let me start by getting oriented with the project structure.

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /app && pwd</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<parameter name="command">cd /app && ls -la</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /app && find . -type f -name "package.json" | head -5</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /app && cat package.json 2>/dev/null || echo "No package.json in root"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /app && ls -la | grep -E '(src|lib|app|pages|components)'</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /app && cat README.md 2>/dev/null | head -50 || echo "No README.md found"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Perfect! I'm warmed up and ready to explore. I can see this is a project with:
- A git repository on the `main` branch
- Some recent modifications to `.claude.json` and `pnpm-lock.yaml`
- Shell snapshots and todos directories
- Recent commits from today

I'm ready to receive your requirements and assigned perspective. I'll thoroughly explore the codebase using read-only tools (Read, Glob, Grep, and read-only Bash commands) to understand the architecture and design a detailed implementation plan.

Please provide:
1. **The requirements** for what needs to be implemented
2. **The perspective** I should apply during the design process (if any specific approach is desired)

I'll then explore the codebase systematically and deliver a comprehensive implementation plan with the critical files identified.
